entries.title: Approvals Drawer is live for Shopify operators

copy.lead: Approvals Drawer is live—every automation waits for a human before it ships.
body: Every dashboard suggestion now routes through the Approvals Drawer with evidence, rollback notes, and reviewer grades before apply.
Stabilized GA4 metrics (last 30 days): Sessions 85,612 (+6.4%), conversion rate 2.51%, revenue $128,450.32 (+8.6%).
Link the HITL review checklist so operators know the approval flow and audit trail before launch day.

launchNotes: Tag CEO and operations owners so approvals SLA expectations land.
Call out GA4 snapshot + live revenue artifact for reviewer validation.
Remind readers that approvals remain in HITL-only mode until CEO sign-off is logged.

rollback.trigger: Approvals validation errors, GA4 metrics drift greater than 5%, or CEO declines launch messaging.
rollback.message: Pausing the Approvals Drawer launch while we investigate a validation issue. Operators should continue the existing manual workflow; we will share an updated go-live once the fix is verified.

entries.title: Launch day email to Shopify operators

copy.subject: Approvals Drawer launches 21 Oct — what to expect
copy.preview: HITL first, metrics-backed confidence, instant rollback.
body: Hi team — the Approvals Drawer is landing on 21 Oct at 10:00 ET.
Why it matters: no automation ships without evidence, rollback, and a human grade. You will see the new drawer from any dashboard tile, and every decision logs in Supabase.
Confidence: Sessions 85,612 (+6.4%), conversion 2.51%, revenue $128,450.32 (+8.6%) from the stabilized GA4 export.
Next steps: follow the HITL checklist, keep pending approvals under 15 minutes, and note any edits in the feedback field for learning.

launchNotes: Send from manager alias; CC analytics owner for quick response on metric questions.
Attach calendar screenshot referencing the drawer ready state.
Call out daily watch window with link to docs/specs/dashboard_launch_checklist.md#6.

dependencies.description: Engineering to resolve lint + SEO CI blockers

rollback.trigger: CI remains red at T-2 hours or analytics export revoked.
rollback.message: We are delaying the Approvals Drawer launch until CI and analytics checks finish. All automations stay in draft-only mode—no action needed on your side while we stabilize.

entries.title: Sampling guard explainer thread

copy.lead: How the sampling guard keeps engagement metrics honest post-launch.
body: Share a 3-step overview of the sampling guard and why we hold wildcard drafts until live engagement data lands.
Include callout card with GA4 snapshot reference + checksum for audit trail.
End with reminder that approvals require evidence hashes before publish.

launchNotes: Thread to publish once analytics delivers engagement export.
Drop screenshot of wildcard draft blocking state from Publer once available.
Coordinate with analytics agent for final engagement rate figure before posting.

dependencies.description: Live engagement export from analytics agent

rollback.trigger: Engagement export indicates anomaly or remains unavailable by 2025-10-24.
rollback.message: Hold the sampling guard explainer until analytics provides a clean engagement dataset. Share a short update in #ops noting the delay and reaffirming that approvals stay evidence-first.

entries.title: Customer testimonials + activation milestone

copy.lead: Activation hits 70% — operators share how Approvals restored confidence.
body: Quote CX lead on faster approvals turnaround.
Highlight activation ≥70% once metric clears, linking to analytics artifact.
Invite readers to the follow-up webinar focused on audit trails.

cta.label: Reserve a seat for the audit trail webinar

launchNotes: Do not publish until activation metric ≥ 0.70 and testimonials recorded.
Collect 2 customer quotes via support lane; attach evidence paths before publish.
Schedule Publer draft `draft-wildcard-001` once dependency clears.

rollback.trigger: Activation metric falls below 0.65 or testimonials vetoed.
rollback.message: With activation trending below target, we are moving the testimonial story back to draft. We will resurface once the 70% milestone is sustained and quotes clear review.

steps: Notify CEO, manager, and analytics owners in #launch-coordination of the pause.
Revert social/email drafts to draft status inside Publer and mark dependencies as blocked in this calendar.
Update docs/specs/dashboard_launch_checklist.md Section 5 with the rollback decision and attach evidence.
Log action + evidence hash in feedback/content/2025-10-18.md and artifacts/content/2025-10-18/calendar_metrics.md.
